lucy: Serena, you know what? You're too smart for your own good. Come here.

Kevin: Mm-hmm.

kevin: Victor, it's a bit of a leap, though, from unidentifiable --
ian: It's a huge leap.
Eve: It's crazy, that's what it is.

lucy: Yoo-hoo. Hello. What are you guys doing? Do you really think we can

Paige: What are you talking about?
Kevin: That's a very long story.

karen: Yeah, I mean, for us to believe that there's some kind of pod person 
that just landed in port charles --
victor: Well, that's not the only thing that just landed in port charles.

Jack: All right, we have no proof that this happened. Besides, you're scaring

Jack: Hey.
Casey: Well, I don't need any more proof. I saw it with my own eyes.
Frank: Saw what?

Casey: The spacecraft. See, i didn't want to say anything because you'd think

whizzed right over my head.
Livvie: Oh, great -- it is true.
Jack: Oh, come on, you know this girl is crazy, all right?

Kevin: Look, livvie, we don't know anything until we know something, ok? 
Relax.
Jack: Yeah.
Lucy: It's you, isn't it?
Paige: Me? What are you --

lucy: Yeah, you know, I checked. You did not arrive on the plane, so i want

rafe: I'm not trying to be secretive. I just -- I never did much daydreaming.

Alison: Oh, come on. You didn't have, like, any little fantasies about, you 
know, I don't know, about being a pirate or --
rafe: Pirate, right.

Alison: Oh, I see. Well, mr. Grounded-in-reality, I mean, you must have done

Rafe: Yeah, well -- yeah, I trained for the job that i was called to do.
Alison: Right -- vampire slayer.

Rafe: Well, slaying all evil forces. See, i knew from the beginning that was

Alison: Right, right, right, but, I mean, you still had to do something fun.

Rafe: Well -- yeah, you know, sometimes I did my training exercises

Alison: Oh, you don't say. Oh, get out of here.
Rafe: Look, I -- people's lives depended on my skills.
Alison: Yes.

Alison: It was an honor. I'm sure you were the -- you are the best at it.

Rafe: Well, you know, you're right, though, because all of this -- this has 
just been amazing, and being here with you, and i never realized how much I 
missed out on till now.

Alison: Well, we're just going to have to make up for that, then. Especially 
now since you don't really have to be fighting any evil mess. You know what I 
mean?
Rafe: Yeah, well, which is a good thing since i don't have my powers.

Alison: And that's ok because you don't need any powers, ok? So for the first

rafe: Right, right.

Rafe: Ok.

Rafe: All right, fun.
Alison: Yeah.
Rafe: Fun.
Alison: Fun.

Lucy: All right, listen, paige -- if that's even your real name -- I want to 
know where you came from.

Kevin: Hey, everyone, please. Let's just try and be rational about this, all 
right?
Livvie: Dad, how can we? Who knows what's out there after us?

Kevin: Because we don't know for sure that anything's after us. But I do know 
that panic isn't going to help.
Paige: I think you should listen to your husband.

Lucy: I'm not finished with you yet. Excuse me. Livvie, your dad's right. 
Panic's not going to help anything. Come on. If -- big "if" -- if there are 
aliens around here, then how do we know they'd do us any harm, anyway? What if 
the aliens are so cute like e.T.? I love e.T.
Livvie: Yeah, lucy, but what if it's not like e.T.?

Lucy: I see what you're saying. Fine, if it's not, then we handle it because 
you know what we handled last time. Us port charlesers are very strong and can 
handle just about anything, right?
Kevin: Right, that's right.
Lucy: Right. Hmm.
Casey: You better be because E.T. Is a fantasy.
Lucy: E.T. Is real.

Casey: Now that movie "alien," that's probably what it's more like. You know, 
those creatures exploding out of people's stomachs --
jack: Hey, casey, all right, that's enough.
Casey: Oh, what's wrong? Wittle wivvie is scared of the boogie man?
Jack: I said that's enough, all right?

Livvie: No, no, jack, what if she's right? What if they do mean us harm? You 
know, it wouldn't be the first time something's come after us.

Amy: Livvie, I don't really know what's going on, but it is true what they 
say about the blind -- heightened senses and all that. And the one thing that i 
can tell you is I don't feel any danger. And I don't believe there are any 
aliens here.

Livvie: Ok, there was a time when i wouldn't have believed it, either, but

Amy: No, but it's pretty clear it left you with a great deal of fear. But it

Livvie: Yeah. We can, and we did, didn't we?
Kevin: Just who exactly are you?
Lucy: Looking for somebody?
Paige: No, I was just --

lucy: I'm not going away, paige. I want you to tell me the truth. Who are you

Paige: I told you, my flight got rerouted.

Lucy: Are you daft? I told youhecked there was no plane that landed from

Paige: Via spacecraft.

Lucy: Look, you, i know there is something off about you. Maybe you're not

Paige: For pete's sake, lucy, I'm not a space alien.
Lucy: Fine. Then how do you explain the ageless alien skin, huh?

Paige: It's called good genes and staying out of the sun -- not hard to do in

Lucy: Are you being flip with me? Fine. You know what I'm going to do? I am 
just going to go tell everybody that you're a liar.
Paige: No, ok. You got me. I'm from planet nitar. Third star from your sun.
Lucy: Now I'm really mad. I'm going to scream it. Doc, everybody --
paige: Please -- wait --
lucy: I have something -- paige wants to --
paige: Please, please, please.
Lucy: All right, I'm listening.

Paige: All right. I lied about how i got here and why I showed up on kevin's

Lucy: Big surprise.
Paige: The truth is i came to port charles to find kevin. I need him.
rafe: And what about you? What do you dream about?
Alison: Oh, well, see, now i -- I was a very materialistic kind of girl.
Rafe: Hmm.
Alison: See, i thought that i was going to die if I didn't get a beemer.
Rafe: Oh.
Alison: Hey, you.
Rafe: What about now?

Alison: Well, now my dreams are really simple. See, all i want to do is build

travel, and I just want to grow old together.

Rafe: Well, then -- oh, that's lucky, then, because you pretty much got that

Alison: Yeah. I'm not so sure now.

Rafe: No, you know what? I'm telling you, this stuff going on with jamal,

Alison: I don't know. See, jamal and i, we used to be like this really great 
team. You know, I mean, we could handle, like, anything that came our way. We 
would handle it together, and now I just -- you know, I'm sorry. I'm not going 
to do this. Look -- let's don'T. The point is -- I'm just feeling, like, really

rafe: Hey, hey -- hey?
Alison: What?
Rafe: I have never known anyone less selfish than you.
Alison: Have i told you how nice it is to have you back?
Rafe: Have i told you how great it is to be back?
Alison: Well, and there's something else that I'm grateful for.
Rafe: What's that?

Alison: I'm just grateful that everything's getting back to normal. All this 
evilness is behind us.

Lucy: You know, I'm beginning to feel you really are daft. I don't know if 
you've noticed, but kevin is truly unavailable.
Paige: No, no, no, you don't understand.

Lucy: Ok, why don't you make me understand? Shall we bond? Sit, sit, please. 
Go ahead.

Paige: Lucy, everything i told you two was a lie. Well, not everything. My 
husband did die a while ago, and afterward, i didn't know where to turn. I 
didn't know what to do, so i decided to go home -- to my family's home in 
england. Thought at least i'd find some comfort there.
Lucy: Oh, but, alas, you didn't.

Paige: At first i wasn't really sure why. God, it's such a beautiful old 
place, extraordinary just in its history, most of which hangs on the walls. 
These grand, spectacular portraits of all my illustrious ancestors. Generation 
after generation of past smiths, dating back to centuries.
Lucy: Ah, that's so lovely. And the point of any of this is?

Paige: The point is that i realized i've contributed nothing to that history. 
You know, my husband's gone. I don't have children. I'm essentially alone in the 
world, which made me think of kevin and how close we once were.
Lucy: Ok, go on.

Paige: I remembered how well he knew me, understood me, like -- well, like no 
one I've ever known. And that's when I realized that he's the only one who can 
help me -- help me leave my legacy to the world, a testimony to who i am and who 
i've loved for future generations.
Lucy: Oh, my gosh. You want kevin to make you pregnant?
Paige: No, lucy. What i want is for kevin to paint me.

That's the best thing that's happened to us all day long, right?

Rafe: Well, like i said, I didn't get out much.

Alison: Ok, well, don't worry because I will teach you everything. We've just

rafe: Whoa! No, no, no, no.

Alison: Jamal.
Paige: God, i had no idea this town was so exciting.
Lucy: Oh, it definitely has its moments.
Paige: Lucy, could I ask you to do something for me?
Lucy: Um -- ok what?

Paige: Could you not say anything to kevin about me wanting him to paint my

Lucy: Why would I do that after you've come all this way for that reason?

Paige: Yeah, but that was before i knew that he was a newlywed with kids. 
It's clearly an imposition, and I'm very sorry to have --

lucy: No, no. No, no. You know, I guess I feel the need for an apology coming 
on myself. I apologize. I think I misjudged your motives.
Paige: It's all right. I'm often mistaken for a space alien.
Lucy: I actually have that happen to me all the time for real.
Paige: You do?

Lucy: But -- yeah. No -- but the point is, is i know what it feels like, sort 
of. If i didn't have my doc and my two little girls, you know, I don't know -- 
well, that's a whole other story. Listen, I admire you for wanting to leave 
something behind. I think it's very sweet and very admirable, so I would like to 
help you get doc to paint you, but i have to tell you he hasn't picked up a

Paige: I don't think you can lose a talent like kevin's.

Lucy: No, you're right. He's so amazing, you know -- I think I'm the one 
person in the whole world, except for maybe you, too, that -- no, he's an 
amazing artist. You know, I actually arranged a show one time and it was huge. 
Big-bang success.
Paige: Really?
Lucy: Yeah.
Paige: So do you think he'd do it?

Lucy: I'll tell you what. I, as mrs. Doc, will make him do it. I'll make sure 
that kevin paints you.
Paige: Oh, thank you. You have no idea what this means to me.
Lucy: Well, you're welcome, and welcome to port charles.

Paige: Thank you. So, do you think that job offer at your company is still 
open?
Lucy: Oh -- sure. Why not?
Paige: Looks like i might be staying for a while.
Eve: Ok, well, that was enough excitement for the day, huh?
Ian: That lits quite a handful.

Amy: I've worked with a lot of girls just like her. She's obviously very 
troubled.

Kevin: You know what? That reminds me -- before all the commotion outside, 
there was a job I was going to tell you about, an opening. Ian: Not to step on 
your toes here, kevin, but i was about to offer you a job at the G.H. Clinic, a 
counselor.
Kevin: That's the job i was going to tell you about.
Ian: Oh, good.

Eve: Amy -- amy, this is fantastic. You should really consider it. You'd meet 
a lot of really nice people, and it's very rewarding work.
Ian: The pay is no good, but eve's right about the rest of it.
Amy: Well, how can I turn down an offer like that?
Ian: You accept, then?
Amy: I think port charles is going to be just the right place for me.
